question: Nothing like an old-school safety brief to put your mind at ease. CUT TO:
answer: Hey, you're Jake right? Tom's brother? You look just like him. Sorry, I'm Norm Spellman, I went through avatar training with him. He was a great guy -- funny. It was a big shock to all of us.

question: Yeah.
answer: And duh! -- obviously you look like him. I mean, if you weren't genetically identical, you wouldn't be taking over his avatar.

question: That's why I'm here.
answer: So -- you want to go check it out? CUT TO:

question: It looks like him.
answer: No, it looks like you. This is your avatar now, Jake.

question: The idea is -- every driver is matched to his own avatar -- -- so their nervous systems are in tune. Or something. Which is why they offered me this gig, because I can link with Tommy's avatar, which was insanely expensive. Is this right? I just say whatever in these videologs?
answer: Yeah. You just need to get in the habit of documenting everything -- what you see, what you feel -- it's all part of the science. Good science starts with good observation.

question: Yeah, yeah, I know who you are, and I don't need you. I need your brother. You know -- the PhD who trained three years for this mission.
answer: He's dead. I know it's a big inconvenience to everyone.

question: How much lab training have you had? Ever run a gas chromatograph?
answer: No.

question: Any actual lab work at all?
answer: High school chemistry. But I ditched.

question: Parker, I used to think it was benign neglect, but now I see you're intentionally screwing us.
answer: Grace. You know I enjoy our little talks.

question: I need a research assistant, not some jarhead dropout.
answer: Actually, we got lucky with him.

question: Lucky? How is this in any way lucky?
answer: Well -- lucky your guy had a twin brother, and lucky the brother wasn't an oral hygienist or something. A Marine we can use. I'm assigning him to your team as security escort.

question: The last thing I need is another trigger happy asshole out there!
answer: Look, you're supposed to be winning the hearts and minds of the natives. Isn't that the whole point of your little puppet show? If you look like them, if you talk like them, they'll trust you? But after -- how many years? -- relations with the indigenous are only getting worse.

question: That tends to happen when you use machine guns on them.
answer: This is why we're here. Unobtanium. Because this little gray rock sells for twenty million a kilo. No other reason. This is what pays for the party. And it's what pays for your science. Comprendo? Those savages are threatening our whole operation. We're on the brink of war and you're supposed to be finding a diplomatic solution. So use what you've got and get me some results. CUT TO:

question: Like -- an hour.
answer: Tell me you're joking.

question: Don't! I got this.
answer: So you just figured you'd come out here to the most hostile environment known to man, with no training of any kind, and see how it went? What was going through your head?

question: Maybe I was just tired of doctors telling me what I couldn't do.
answer: Relax and let your mind go blank. That shouldn't be hard for you.

question: Sully -- Colonel wants to see you in the Armor Bay.
answer: You guys're packing some heavy ordinance.

question: Yeah, `cause we're not the only thing flyin' around out there. Or the biggest. I'm gonna need you on a door gun, I'm a man short.
answer: Yeah, no problem.

question: See, right here where the roots of the two trees interact. Don't shoot. You'll piss it off.
answer: It's already pissed off!

question: Jake, that armor's too thick. Trust me. It's a territorial threat display. Do not run, or he'll charge.
answer: What do I do?

question: Hold your ground!
answer: Oh yeah! Who's bad?! That's right. That's what I'm talkin' about, bitch! That's right motherf-- What about this one? Run, don't run? What?

question: Rrreeyaaah! Hyaaaah!! Raaaarrrr!
answer: Wait, don't --

question: Forgive me, my brother.
answer: Look, um, I know you probably don't understand this. But -- thanks. Thank you. I owe you.

question: Forgive me. May your spirit run with the Great Mother.
answer: I would have been screwed if you hadn't come along -- Hey, wait. Wait! Where you goin'? Slow down a second will you. I just want to thank you for killing those --

question: Don't thank! You don't thank for this! This is sad. Very sad, only.
answer: Okay, I'm sorry. Whatever I did -- I'm sorry.

question: All this is your fault! They did not need to die.
answer: They attacked me. How'm I the bad guy

question: Your fault! You are like a baby, making noise, don't know what to do. You should not come here, all of you! You only come and make problems. Only.
answer: Okay, fine, you love your little forest friends. So why not just let them kill my ass? What's the thinking?

question: Why save you?
answer: Yes, why save me?

question: You have a strong heart. No fear. But stupid! Ignorant like a child!
answer: If I'm so ignorant, maybe you should teach me.

question: Sky people can not learn. You do not See.
answer: Whooaa. Then teach me to "see."

question: No one can teach you to See.
answer: Hey, slow down. Look, I think we just got off on the wrong foot and -- --you just have to get to know me. I'm Jake. Jake Sull-- Whooaaa -- shit! I need your help.

question: You should not be here.
answer: So take me with you.

question: No. You go back.
answer: What? What are they?

question: Atokirina'. Seeds of the Great Tree -- very pure spirits.
answer: What was that all about?

question: Come! CUT TO:
answer: What's your name? What's going on?

question: My father is deciding whether to kill you.
answer: Your father!? Uh, good to meet you, sir.

question: That is Mother. She is Tsahik -- the one who interprets the will of Eywa.
answer: Who's Eywa?

question: Who's Eywa?
answer: What are you called?

question: Jake Sully.
answer: Why did you come to us?

question: I came to learn.
answer: We have tried to teach other Sky People. It is hard to fill a cup which is already full.

question: My cup is empty, trust me. Just ask Doctor Augustine. I'm no scientist.
answer: What are you?

question: I don't know. I was a Marine -- uh, a warrior. Of the Jarhead clan. What's going on? What are they saying?
answer: Daughter. You will teach him our way, to speak and walk as we do. My daughter will teach you our ways. Learn well, Jakesully. We will see if your insanity can be cured.

question: So it's all good, right? You and me --
answer: Do not speak. CUT TO:

question: Don't get up. You never told me your name.
answer: Neytiri te Ckaha Mo'at'ite.

question: Okay, again, a whole lot slower.
answer: Neytiri. Nay-TEE-ree.

question: That's some damn fine teylu. That's like grandma's teylu.
answer: Come on back, kid, that's it.

question: Wha --? Oh.
answer: Damn, you were dug in like a tick. Is the avatar safe?

question: Yeah, Doc -- and you are not going to believe where I am. CUT TO:
answer: -- so the kid's out there one night and he's got the Queen Bitch herself offering him the spare room and the car keys. Unbelievable.

question: Look, Sully -- find out what these blue monkeys want. Their damn village is sitting right over the richest unobtanium deposit for a hundred klicks in any direction. Which sucks -- for them -- because they need to relocate.
answer: Does Augustine know about this?

question: Yeah, she does, and she's on the next ship back if she tries to cock-block me on it.
answer: So -- who talks them into moving? What if they won't go?

question: Holy shit.
answer: Do not look in her eye. Ikran is not horse. Once shahaylu is made, ikran will fly with only one Hunter in the whole life. To become taronyu -- Hunter -- you must choose your own ikran. And he must choose you.

question: When?
answer: When you are ready. Heeyaaahh!

question: Yeah, yeah. The days are starting to blur together. The language is a bitch, but I figure it's like field-stripping a weapon. Repetition. Seyri. Ontu, mikyun, nari. Neytiri thinks I'm some kind of retard. Norm's attitude has improved lately.
answer: Thank you?

question: Ireiyo.
answer: Irrrreiyo. Irrrreiyo. You've gotta roll the R, r-r-r-oll it.

question: You're still losing weight. Here --
answer: I made a kill today. We ate it. I know where that meal came from.

question: Other body. You need to take care of this body.
answer: Yeah yeah.

question: Jake, I'm serious -- you look like crap. You're burning too hard.
answer: Get rid of this shit, then you can lecture me.

question: I'm telling you, as your boss and someone who might even consider being a friend someday, to take some down time.
answer: Not now. Tomorrow we leave for Iknimaya.

question: Yeah -- you're gonna go ride a banshee. Or die trying.
answer: That's right, Grace. This is what I've been working for.

question: And this is your check up from the neck up, Marine. You're getting in way too deep. Trust me, I learned the hard way.
answer: What did happen at the school?

question: Neytiri's sister -- Sylwanin -- stopped coming to school. She was angry about the clear-cutting. One day, she and a couple of other young hunters came running in, all painted up -- they'd set a bulldozer on fire -- I guess they thought I could protect them. The troopers pursued them to the schoolhouse. They killed Sylwanin in the doorway. Right in front of Neytiri. Then shot the others.
answer: Jesus.

question: Yeah. A scientist stays objective -- we can not be ruled by emotion. But I poured ten years of my life into that school. They called me sa'atenuk. Mother. That kind of pain reaches back through the link. It's a job. Learn what you can -- but don't get attached. It's not our world, Jake. And we can't stop what's coming. CUT TO:
answer: Iknimaya translates roughly as stairway to heaven. It's the test every young hunter has to pass. We doin' this?

question: How will I know if he chooses me?
answer: He will try to kill you.

question: Outstanding. Let's dance. That's right! You're mine.
answer: First flight seals the bond. You cannot wait.

question: Go ahead.
answer: Jake is making incredible progress, years worth in just a few months. But -- we need more time.

question: Not what I was hoping to hear.
answer: Parker, it's their ancestral home. They've lived there since before human history began. You can spare them a few more weeks.

question: You're not gettin' lost in the woods, are you son? Your last report was two weeks ago. I'm starting to doubt your resolve. From what I see, it's time to terminate this mission.
answer: No. I can do this.

question: Look, you've given me plenty of usable intel. Like this "Well of Souls" place -- I've got them by the balls with that, when it turns into a shit-fight. Which it will. So you'll get your legs back, like I promised. (puts his hand on Jake's
answer: I've gotta finish this thing. There's one more test -- the Dream Hunt. It's the final stage of becoming a man. Then I'm one of them. They'll trust what I say... ... and I can negotiate the terms of their relocation.

question: That's right -- to embed with the Omaticaya. To find out how to screw them out of their home. By deceit or by force, he didn't care. And if it turned out to be force, then how best to do it.
answer: And what about now, Jake?

question: I'm not that guy any more.
answer: I know.

question: This is a place for prayers to be heard. And sometimes answered.
answer: It's like -- a sound you feel.

question: We call this utraya mokri -- the Tree of Voices. The voices of our ancestors, who live within Eywa. You are Omaticaya now. You may make your own bow from the wood of Hometree. And you may choose a woman. We have many fine women. Ninat is the best singer --
answer: I don't want Ninat.

question: There is Beyral -- she is a good hunter --
answer: I've already chosen. But this woman must also choose me.

question: She already has. Kissing is very good. But we have something better.
answer: Neytiri, you know my real body is far away, sleeping.

question: This body is real. This spirit is real. When I was first your teacher, I hated all Sky People. But you have also taught me. I am with you now, Jake. We are mated for life.
answer: We are?

question: Yes. It is our way.
answer: Really, we are?

question: We are.
answer: It's cool. I'm there.

question: Alright, look -- I don't have the answers yet, I'm just now starting to even frame the questions. What we think we know -- is that there's some kind of electrochemical communication between the roots of the trees. Like the synapses between neurons. Each tree has ten to the fourth connections to the trees around it, and there are ten to the twelfth trees on Pandora --
answer: That's a lot I'm guessing.

question: That's more connections than the human brain. You get it? It's a network -- a global network. And the Na'vi can access it -- they can upload and download data -- memories -- at sites like the one you destroyed.
answer: What the hell have you people been smoking out there? They're just. Goddamn. Trees.

question: They sent me here to learn your ways. So one day I could bring this message, and you would believe it.
answer: What are you saying, Jake? You knew this would happen?

question: Yes.
answer: I trusted you, Jake!

question: Neytiri. Please, I only wanted to --
answer: You will never be one of the People! NEVER!

question: Take it nice and easy, troop. On the ground, face down. Hands behind your head.
answer: Do what he goddamn says!

question: Go! Go! Go! Oh yeah, baby!
answer: Aaahh, crap. Not again. This is gonna ruin my whole day.

question: Hang on, Grace. CUT TO:
answer: Well, at least they won't be able to track us up here. Not this deep in the vortex.

question: It's strongest at the Well of Souls, right?
answer: Yeah.

question: Good, `cause that's where we're going.
answer: Copy.

question: Hang on, they're gonna fix you up.
answer: I -- always held back. But you gave them your heart. I'm proud of you, Jake. Help them. You do whatever it takes. You hear me?

question: I will.
answer: I'm with her Jake -- -- she's real --

question: People, you are fighting for survival. There's an aboriginal horde out there massing for an attack. First slide. These orbital images show the hostiles' numbers have gone from a couple of hundred to over two thousand in one day, and more are pouring in. By next week it could be twenty thousand. Then they'll be overrunning our perimeter here. We can't wait. Our only security lies in pre- emptive attack. We will fight terror with terror. Next slide. This mountain stronghold is supposedly protected by their deity. When we destroy it, we will blast a crater in their racial memory so deep they won't come within a thousand klicks of this place. CUT TO:
answer: This thing is completely out of control! Listen to me! I am not authorizing you to turn the mine-workers local into a freakin' militia!

question: I declared threat condition red. That puts all on-world assets under my command.
answer: You think you can pull this palace coup shit on me?! I can have your ass with one call --

question: You're a long way from Earth. Get him out of here.
answer: You touch me you're so fired.

question: Can you talk to Selfridge? Maybe we can cut some kinda deal before this thing goes all the way.
answer: No, Quaritch has taken over. He's rolling and there's no stopping him.

question: When?
answer: Oh six hundred tomorrow.

question: Then I guess we better stop him.
answer: You need to get some rack.

question: Gonna have to settle for coffee. CUT TO: I was a warrior who dreamed he could bring peace. But there was only one thing I was ever really good at. Ooh-rah. Strike here and here. Yeah.
answer: Going up against gunships with bows and arrows...

question: I See you, Tsu'tey te Rongloa Ateyitan.
answer: Are the people safe?

question: They're safe.
answer: I can never ride again, or bond with my woman -- or hear the voice of Eywa. I can not lead the People. You will lead them, Jakesully.

question: No. I'm not officer material.
answer: It is decided. Now do the duty of Olo'eyctan. Set my spirit free.

question: I'm not killing you.
answer: I am already dead.

question: No.
answer: It is the way. And it is good. I will be remembered -- -- I fought with Toruk Macto, we were brothers -- and he was my last shadow.
